titleStmt.title: Instructions and rules to be duly observed by each and every master-gunner entertained upon any ship, friggot, or vessel of war, which either now, or hereafter shall be in the service of his Majesty, / by order of his Royal Highness, James, Duke of York and Albany, Earl of Ulster, Lord High Admiral of England and Ireland, &c.
titleStmt.author: James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

titleStmt.title: Instructions and rules to be duly observed by each and every master-gunner entertained upon any ship, friggot, or vessel of war, which either now, or hereafter shall be in the service of his Majesty, / by order of his Royal Highness, James, Duke of York and Albany, Earl of Ulster, Lord High Admiral of England and Ireland, &c.
titleStmt.author: James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

notesStmt.note: Dated and signed at end: Given under my hand and seal at Whitehall this twentieth day of April, 1663. James.
Imperfect: creased with slight loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
For regulating the ceremony of honour in salutes -- Rules for preventing the unnecessary waste and expense of stores -- Rules for keeping and retiring the gunners accompts.
